transcript.text: See if you can recognize what’s appropriate and what’s not. Drag each item onto either the Appropriate or Not Appropriate box then click on Submit.

contentText.text: Read the following situations and decide if it would be appropriate or not to accept competitive intelligence under the circumstances.

instructionText.text: Drag each item onto one of the two boxes then click on Submit.
Click the Try again button to retry.

option.option: A competitor has posted job ads for expertise that suggests a change in their strategy
You obtain a transcript of a speech by a competitor’s CEO who spoke at an industry conference last year and shared details of recent production improvements.
You study the product drawings in a competitor’s recent patent application
A former colleague now works for a competitor and shares information about their key contracts with you
A contractor who also works for your competitor offers to show you some product drawings he has on his phone
A new employee was previously working for a competitor, so you ask them for pricing details about that company’s new service

correct.text: It’s appropriate to accept competitive intelligence when it comes from publicly available sources.
Never put anyone in a position where they have to violate their confidentiality obligations to another company.

incorrect.text: It’s appropriate to accept competitive intelligence when it comes from publicly available sources.
